author: {'steamid': '76561198014445897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1467977281}
review:
7/10

A good horror game. It has a slow start and a few issues that hinder the game's potential, but the game picks up later on and definitely becomes a much scarier game. It's a game where actually too scared actually does cause your character to die.

Talking about the cons first...

Among the game's issues, two of them stand out. The first of them is that the game can be really confusing. Basically, during most of the game, you'll be looking for keys to open doors and find notes - each time you read a note, you advance one day, and on the way you'll be collecting batteries for your flashlight and matches to light candles.

The first issue is that actually finding the keys can often be an issue. Right off the start of the game, you have to find a key to unlock the main gate... Which is lying right on the ground. But actually spotting the key is hard, because the color of the key slightly blends with the color of the ground. The game does spot items with a red contour, but only if you get really close to them - which isn't saying the game should just make items shine in the dark and make things too easy, specially since most of the game is about exploring the mansion, but the game does make it hard sometimes to find the necessary items. There were times I triggered events that were supposed to reveal keys to me and I still couldn't spot them. I admit I actually almost gave up on the game on the beginning because I was running all around the mansion and couldn't find the keys I had to find.

On this note, I should also add that using the keys will add slightly to the confusion, because the game doesn't tell them apart - it just tells you how many keys you're holding, but you have to try out each door until you find the one the key opens. However, I don't consider this a flaw. It's part of how the game works as, once again, exploration is a big part of the game.

The second issue is pacing and knowing what's the next step to take during the game. As I've mentioned at the beginning of this review, the game has a slow start. During the beginning, there's a lot of frustration involved while you're going around looking for keys to open doors and finding notes and it takes a while before things actually start to get creepy. The game is divided between 30 days and some of them are longer than others - there are days that are actually pretty easy, short and scareless to beat, while others can be a lot longer and scarier. The game's story that you learn from the notes you find don't help much in telling you where to go next. Sometimes you read a note and you think you know where to go on the next day, but then you find out you were wrong. In fact, very often it's actually better to just sit near a candle light and wait for the character to talk to himself, which is when you get tips on what to do next, so you know where to go or what to do.

Now, for the pros - which is where the game actually gets really good.

After you get past the game's slow start, you find out how scary the game can be. The game successfully creates a creepy atmosphere with a combination of elements in all the right places - statues, paintings, objects, everything makes the player feel like everything is observing him/her or that everything could be a trigger for a jump scare - even objects reflecting light in the distance can look like something creepy, like a pair of glowing eyes. As you explore the house, you'll run into certain events, some of which are pre-determined for each day, while others are random, and they're meant to, as you'd expect, scare you. And the game actually tries to measure how much you're scared, based on your response to those events. If the game detects you're scared, you lose health, so you have to do your best to stay put while the game tries to surprise you, in order to stay alive. (The problem with this "scare-o-meter" in the game is that it could actually be improved, as sometimes it doesn't work as intended. I won't spoil the actual mechanics, but I've read how it works and tried it out and there are times when I lost health even though I had no response to some events.)

There are different events that will try to undermine your health. It's not about running away from ghosts or hiding from monsters, but actually a little of everything. You never know if there is something behind the next door you open. Even events like a phone ringing all of a sudden or a whisper coming from behind you can be enough to take away your health. As you progress further on, you'll unlock more places inside the mansion and the more you explore, the more room the game has to try and catch you by surprise and the more events will be available to do so. Closer to the end of the game, actually trying to stay put in order to not lose health becomes quite challenging. You do recover health at the start of each day, but only a portion of it, so if you get scared a lot during each day, eventually the character will die. You can try to make use of daylight when a new day begins, but it lasts very little and soon everything is all dark again. And in some cases, you have to wait for night time anyway.

Even after you beat the game, there is still an extra playable mode (two, actually, but one of them is just a mode to freely explore the mansion) that adds a little more to the game. In this mode, you have to find the 8 Scarecrow letters while avoiding the Scarecrow (inspired by Slenderman, apparently). It doesn't use the health system, so getting scared is no longer a problem, but then the game is fully randomized in this mode, with no pre-determined events and random locations for items. And I'll admit that while I finished the main game without quitting at any time, this extra mode actually made me nope out of the game, which is quite an achievement since only one other game made me do it before.

I've been reading about Pineview Drive II and, personally, I believe there's a lot of potential for a sequel. If they can address the game's current issues (keys that are hard to find, knowing what to do next and the health system not always working as intended) for the next game, I could easily see Pineview Drive II becoming one of my favorite horror games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17517, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1467878542}
review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Pineview Drive
[b]Developer:[/b]  UIG International GmbH
[b]Publisher:[/b]  United Independent Entertainment GmbH
[b]Genre:[/b]  Horror

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
Seeing its asking price, I was honestly expecting at least a decent  indie horror experience the likes of which, Slender, Outlast and countless others can be used as examples over the years. You really don‚Äôt need an inflated budget to pull off an authentically frightening gameplay sequence. And yet this title has very little to show other than some fairly nice graphical details. The mansion itself isn‚Äôt half bad, if only the amount of key hunting instances wouldn‚Äôt also involve a lot of backtracking. Sadly it does and without spoiling anything from its generic plot, the game can‚Äôt sustain itself on the flimsy story it currently presents. I really wish I could have given it at least a rating of 6 (seeing as it includes Cards and Achievements), but it asks for too much and offers too little in return.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Pleasant graphics and sounds.
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Rather boring than scary.
- Overpriced.

[b]Rating 5/10[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews]Imperial Reviews[/url].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198176008658', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1529192096}
review:
You drive up to a spooky mansion. You enter its spooky gates. You unlock the spooky door. The mechanics are set. You spend the first day in tedium. Looking for unlocked doors to find keys. To unlock doors. To find keys. To unlock doors. To find keys. You stumble around in the darkness like a fitfull drunkard, because the home owners buy their bulbs at discount bulb bulk barn. You find some flashlight batteries. Your character can't figure out how to pick them up without first finding the flashlight. Because your character is an idiot. You find a flashlight. Rejoice! The flashlight casts a bright beam. At last! The flashlight drops one level in power. You're back in the darkness. The flashlight doesn't understand how to flashlight. Two minutes later, it burns out completely. You had one job, flashlight. Find batteries. Replace batteries. Spend flashlight battery power looking for more batteries.

There's spooky stuff happening. But who cares because you can't see it. Spooky stuff repeats. The ghosts are annoyed you're not paying attention to them. You visit rooms. You look for keys. You re-visit rooms. You unlock doors. You find more keys. You re-re-visit rooms. You un-lock doors. You re-re-revisit rooms. You trigger some arbitrary event. You go to sleep. You wake up and realize you have to do it all over again. You walk out the front door and leave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077734452', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1506900765}
review:
Als Kind spielte ich gern Luigis Mansion f√ºr den GameCube, nun bin ich erwachsen geworden und mag Pineview Drive. Man wird sacht eingef√ºhrt und bei voranschreiten der N√§chte werden immer mehr zuf√§llige Events eingebaut, die einen erschrecken. Die Mechanik, ein gro√ües Haus zu betreten, welches man nach und nach erforscht und Schl√ºssel sammelt, um weiterzukommen, finde ich richtig gut und daher finde ich dieses Spiel noch besser als Obscuritas. Denn dort kann ich mich bei stetem Umgebungswechsel nicht an eben diese gew√∂hnen.

Die Geschichte wird zu gro√üen Teilen dem Spieler √ºberlassen, das Spiel gibt Hinweise, wenn man zu lange stockt und die Atmosph√§re ist dicht. Es gibt meinerseits nur zwei Verbesserungsvorschl√§ge. Die Schreckleiste funktioniert nicht immer. Manchmal erschrecke ich mich gar nicht und der Charakter keucht wie Hulle. Au√üerdem h√§tte ich bei dem riesigen Haus eine Map eingebaut, wo man sehen kann, welche T√ºren noch verschlossen sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034746981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1464358282}
review:
I'd recommend this game!
It's a game you approach with an open mind trying to understand the who, what, where, when and why? 

This is one of those games where at first you're curious what kind of horrors this game could bring about. So you dive into it and realize that you're constantly backtracking to look for keys that open other doors and then you rage quit for a couple of minutes exiting the game and then suddenly... something inside you calls you back into this game making you want to know whats behind every door so you continue running around this mansion trying to figure out what door will open next and then you become paranoid about every little thing in this house and you become completely hooked! Hahaha. 

Just a little note, based on how you react to the minor scares decreases your Health Bar/Scare Meter and the lower it gets the more scares that will appear. You could actually get through a level without a single scare if you keep your sanity together. 

The only cons I have is that unless you have a monster graphics card you'll probably need to keep the resolution low.... 
and the game is a bit on the dark side but, with the recent 2.0 update your flashlight battery will last a lot longer than before which is a plus for new comers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084082181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1462013187}
review: I've just finished the game! After reading alot of reviews insulting the game, saying it's a key finding simulator, The ending is rubbish etc. I disagree, the game was amazing. I had alot fun, I was terrified about 95% while playing this game haha. At the begining it was a little confusing where do i go to, how do i find my way around. Once the shortcuts starting coming in, I started finding my way around faster. I absolutely loved the game. I jumped far too many times though haha. the ending was awesome, The only thing i'd have liked was maybe a longer ending video to kind of explain it a little better. But even so i had alot of fun at the ending. unlike most horror games, your health goes down everytime you jump etc, so for the final day it's an extreme struggle to keep still haha. 9/10 Please bring out more developers!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011706249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1446609687}
review:
Solo el payaso me ca√≠a bien, ah si y el espantapajaros.

Cuento corto: Pasas 30 dias buscando a una mujer desaparecida, descubriendo los secretos de una "mansi√≥n", abriendo puertas y mas puertas, tratando de entender los misterios, todo "bien" hasta que llegas al final y terminas diciendo "Que diablos esta pasando, que mierda es este final" y piensas "este muchacho encontr√≥ dos sensuales generadores que resuelven todo el misterio del juego" y tu coraz√≥n se rompe NO DE SUSTO si  que de DECEPCI√ìN. 

Lo bueno: Graficamente es bonito, el ambiente, la mansi√≥n, los detalles. Quiz√°s hubiesen agregado mas cosas para "descubrir" y quiz√°s hay mas cosas, depende del gusto del jugador.

Lo malo:  La historia. Va espectacular y termina en un gigantesco WTF. Sin sentido, el juego en si, se da muchas vueltas, muchas llaves, como que pierdes el sentido de la orientaci√≥n buscando.

Pudo ser mucho mejor, pero al menos para pasar un "rato" de susto, sirve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045145965', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1589840368}
review:
Kommen wir zu diesem Spiel.
Ich muss ganz ehrlich sagen ich bin √ºberrascht √ºber dieses Game. Daf√ºr das es das erste Horror Game der entwickler VIS-Games ist ist es wirklich gut geworden.

Gameplay:
Das Gameplay besteht darin das Mann in und um einem Haus auf der Pineview Drive Schl√ºssel und hinweise finden muss um Vorran zukommen.
Die bewegungen des Charakters sind Typisch f√ºr diese Art von Games (sehr tr√§ge, langsam).
Das Setting ist D√ºster und Erdr√ºckend.

Story:
Es geht im gro√üen und ganzen darum das mann Herausfinden muss was mit Linda (ich nehme mal an die Frau des Protagonisten) vor 20 Jahren passiert ist. Dazu muss mann allerlei R√§tsel l√∂sen und Schl√ºssel zu fast s√§mtlichen T√ºren finden. Ja ich sagte fast, 2 oder 3 R√§ume konnte ich w√§rend des Spielens nicht √∂ffnen.
Story technisch l√§sst dieses Game (unter betrachtung das es das Erste Horror Game dieser Entwickler ist) auch keine W√ºnsche offen.
Ja klar viele werden jetzt sagen da kann mann noch mehr raus holen. Mann die Umgebung sch√∂ner gestalten, und, und, und.

Fazit:
B√∂se Zungen behaupten ja das sich das Spiel Prinziep die 30 Tage √ºber st√§ndig wiederholt. Was an sich stimmt. Dennoch hat VIS-Games es geschafft mit Schreckverzerrten Gesichtern, einen immer wieder verschwindenden Clown, und einer echt Creepy Vogelscheuche es geschafft mir so einige Schockmomente zu verpassen.
das Spiel bekommt von mir eine 8 von 10 Punkten da ich doch kleinere aber leicht zu √ºbersehende fehler (nur umgebungstechnisch) gefunden habe.

Danke f√ºr die aufmerksamkeit und das Lesen des Reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027358581', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1461053576}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel gespielt und auf Twitch gestreamt.
Nachdem ich es nun 31h Stunden gespielt habe muss ich sagen ein sehr ansprechendes und spannendes Game.

Es hatte eine wunderbare dr√ºckende atmosph√§re die mich und meine Zuschauer eingefangen hat.
Die sounds wie auch die jumpscares sind wirklich toll gewesen. Breit gef√§chtere Ideen die gut umgesetzt wurden.

Ich kann das Game jede horrorspiele Freund empfehlen es, es war f√ºr mich ein "G√§nsehaut" emulator *lach*
Auch das Addon das nach dem durchspielen freigeschaltet wird "Scarecrow: die 8 Briefe" ist ein sch√∂nes beiwerk die stimmung dort wird sogar noch unangenehmer und einen ticken besser als im Hauptspiel.


Nun kurz und knapp zu den Pros und Cons

Pros:
Gute Sounds (fangen einen ein) "Pssst" 
Tolle Shocker (viele verschiedene)
Steigende Spannungskurven
Leicht zu verstehendes Spielprinzip
Sch√∂ne speichermethode

Cons:
Relativ Apruptes Ende (weiss nicht ob ichs richtig verstanden habe)
Nicht f√ºr zu h√§ufiges Spielen geeignet. (Da man die "spawnpunkte" schnell kennenlernt)
Grafisch nicht f√ºr jeden ansprechend.

Also mein Fazit aus dem ganzen ist dennoch folgendes:
Wenn ihr euch √ºberlegt es zu erwerben, macht es. Es Lohnt sich. Ein wirklich sch√∂nes spiel und macht definitv interesse auf Teil 2.

review: Para ser un juego de exploracion en teoria, esta bastante bien, lo que mas rescato es la gran atmosfera que se percibe con un toque de nostalgia a eso sumarle lo que nuestra mente desea imaginar dentro del mismo contexto por que eso es clave para envolverte mas fuertemente en juegos de tipo exploratorio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1459576220}
review:
"Pineview Drive" coge el concepto de "Five Nigths at Freddy's" y no fabrica basura. Esta vez, en vez de pasar 5 noches en una pizzer√≠a, debemos pasar 30 en una mansi√≥n. Comienzas el primer d√≠a en un camino frente a la mansi√≥n. Yo decid√≠ alejarme de la mansi√≥n por el camino y la pantalla se fundi√≥ en negro. Yo pens√© "¬°[i]Otia[/i], ya me he [i]pasao[/i] el juego!", pero no. Se reinicia y aparezco en el mismo punto que antes, frente a la puerta.
Cada d√≠a comienza con un resplandeciente sol, pero r√°pidamente llega la noche y deberemos ir encendiendo las luces de la mansi√≥n, aunque no alumbren un carajo. Durante el primer d√≠a aprenderemos el sencill√≠simo mecanismo del juego: recorrer la mansi√≥n buscando fen√≥menos paranormales como un flipado de esos de Discovery Channel. Como la casa es muy grande, a veces se hacen las tantas de la noche y no hemos encontrado nada, as√≠ que aparece una frase del estilo "√âse ruido de zambomba me es familiar, deber√≠a mirar en la habitaci√≥n del joven adolescente", entonces vas para all√° y pasa alguna movida rara con soniditos. Cuando acaba, normalmente aparece una llave que te permite abrir otra puerta y encontrar una p√°gina de diario. Cada vez que encuentras una p√°gina de diario y la lees, acaba el d√≠a y empieza el siguiente. Y as√≠ todo el rato. Como veis, no es la octava maravilla, ni un juegazo. De hecho, se hace mon√≥tono a veces, pero si s√≥lo juegas cuando un cani no confunde "hay, ay o ah√≠", conseguir√°s jugar de manera muy espaciada y no hartarte.
Para complicar el asunto, al cabo de varios d√≠as, el sistema el√©ctrico de la casa se fastidia y s√≥lo tendremos que apa√±arnos con la linterna y con las cerillas. No supone mucho problema porque hay cerillas en la casa como para cargar un barco, pero es una molestia, porque las velas que enciendes por la casa alumbran menos que ponerte la cerilla en el ojete para meterle fuego a los cuescos. Tambi√©n, los √∫ltimos d√≠as, en lugar de p√°ginas de diario (en la que nos enteramos de los remedios caseros que usaban para las almorranas, su pasi√≥n por el pressing catch o su loca receta de canelones) tendremos que [spoiler]buscar fragmentos de una foto[/spoiler].
Durante 29 d√≠as haremos esto, pero el √∫ltimo, descubriremos que la barra que hay en la parte superior izquierda sirve para algo, y es que nos adentraremos en [spoiler]un pasillo absurdamente absurdo bajo tierra donde tendremos muchas pajas mentales que nos har√°n disminuir la barra esa[/spoiler]. El √∫ltimo d√≠a se me hizo mucho m√°s dif√≠cil que por ejemplo, todos los anteriores, pero consegu√≠ pas√°rmelo no s√© c√≥mo.
Pienso que es un juego demasiado caro, porque a pesar de haberlo jugado durante unas 14 horas, la mec√°nica es siempre la misma, como un cap√≠tulo de [b]Bioman[/b], que todo daba igual en el cap√≠tulo hasta que sacaban el ca√±√≥n tri√≥nico y lo mandaban todo a tomar por saco, sin embargo, como lo pill√© por alguna oferta salvaje o un bundle furtivo, lo saqu√© barato y entonces s√≠ que vale la pena. Una idea buena, que si se le hubiese a√±adido un toque m√°s de aventura (coger y usar objetos, aparte de llaves) creo que habr√≠a tenido m√°s √©xito.

[b]Debe ser muy mon√≥tono recorrer durante 30 d√≠as los mismo pasillos.[/b] Claro, lo he dicho antes, pero por lo menos, casi cada d√≠a, abrimos nuevas puertas y accedemos a habitaciones nuevas.
[b]¬øDa miedo o es "de sustos"?[/b] La atm√≥sfera es muy buena, con muchos [i]soniditos[/i] inquietantes a medida que te mueves por la casa, pero hay predominancia de sustos.
[b]Por lo que dices, es un juego f√°cil pero largo, porque consiste en pasearte por toooda la casa.[/b] S√≠, muy bien explicado. Si quieres, la pr√≥xima vez analizas t√∫ el juego.
[b]No, da igual. A m√≠ s√≥lo me pagan por venir, tocar un poco los huevos con tres o cuatro preguntas y volverme al bar.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018799950', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1460759015}
review:
First of all: I want to like the game even though it is hard to do so sometimes.

[h1] Story [/h1]
[i]You playing a man who wants to discover what happend to his wife in the 'Pineview Drive' mansion 20 years ago. She is gone since then and you want to recover your lost memories.
People say no one survived more then 30days in the house since then. 
Let the fun begin.[/i]


[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
[i]
Very atmospheric but fuck the gameplay seriously... 
You ran around the house for 30days searching for goddamn keys to unlock one of the 'thousands' doors to continue the story. Sometimes you get a little advise by your protagonist so you know where you have to look... when you can remember the goddamn room he meant.
The jumpscares/scares are pretty good in this one and they will get you mostly when you do not expect them. The sounds and noises in this game are creepy as hell. A scratch there a 'psst'
there you really never feel safe until you found the clue that leads into the next day.
So the game isn't bad but sometimes the contra points annoy you too much.


Played it during the last days together with a buddy because Steam Cloud deleted our previous progress and damn this game is fun (-minus the key search) till it comes to the end. I rage quitted it. Going to finish it but for me the end killed the whole fun for me then.[/i]


Edit: We finished it and it was pretty good overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051317669', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1651566260}
review: Pineview Drive, in my opinion, is a mediocre horror game that had the potential to be much better than it is. It‚Äôs not really a bad game, but it has some major flaws that really drag it down. The good things about the game are: The atmosphere is great for a horror game. The music and sound effects are excellent and really add to the game‚Äôs creepiness. The graphics are great. And the game has some well done scares. The major flaws about the game are: The game is WAY TOO DARK even with the game's brightness setting set to its highest level. You do get a flashlight but it doesn‚Äôt last long enough. And flashlight batteries in the game are few and far between. You may have to turn up the brightness and the contrast on your monitor to their highest levels just to barely see anything when your flashlight is low on battery power. When you start up the game, you can‚Äôt skip the introduction screens. And they are fairly lengthy introduction screens. You can‚Äôt rebind the keys either. It would have been nice if the game had a built in map of the mansion to help the player with finding their way around as you progress through the game‚Äôs 30 days of terror. It would have been nice if each door had its own specific name that relates to the room that it‚Äôs for. And also if the game told you which door each key is for when you find a key. These are major flaws that make me just barely recommend Pineview Drive. It‚Äôs not bad, but it‚Äôs not great either. It‚Äôs just mediocre to me

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2325, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1475960947}
review:
I see a lot of reviews complaining about it being a key finding simulator. but really, the game is much more than that. As the review from Venus explains much better than I can, when you do find a key, it isnt because you found it, but because something in the house wanted you to have it at that time. It keeps the pace of the story, rather than throwing everything (the entire house) at you at once and expecting you to find very specific clues. 

You start out returning to the mansion to find out what happened 20 years ago to a woman named Linda. When you first enter, most of the rooms are locked. So as it gets dark, you explore the yard, enter the house, and poke at the few rooms that are open. At first, its a fairly calm atmosphere, if a little creepy. Once its fully dark though, that changes. Things start happening like objects moving, hearing strange noises, lights flicker out, etc. Rooms youve been to previously have things moved in them occasionally (so its highly recommended to revist rooms youve already been to just to double check for clues). Eventually "something" will lead you to a key, or to an event that will reward you with a key. As you open more rooms, you find more pages, which gives you hints as to what happened 20 years ago. Theres no risk of finding certain pages too early, or too late, as the game gives you the right keys to get to the right pages, in the right order. 

As far as graphics, they arent bad (little dated), but I still got low fps. With a gtx970, I ended up leaving the settings on medium to keep it smooth around 50-60 fps. Its probably an optimization issue, so youll need to play with the settings yourself to see what works best for you.

Audio was fantastic. Loved the atmosphere it created. One thing that did get slightly annoying was that direction of the audio wasnt always a good indicator of which floor it came from. You might be standing on the ground floor, hear something you would swear is directly to your left, then find out it was on the floor above you. Not game breaking, but certainly a little annoying when you are hunting for clues and all you get is an audio one.

Speaking of clues, dont worry about getting stuck for too long. One of my biggest issues with indie horror games, is that it can be easy to get "stuck" and break the flow of the game if you overlook something, or just cant figure out a puzzle. This game has a very nice (and my new favorite) system for giving you hints when you get stuck/take too long to get to the next clue. After about 15 minutes or so, your character will say something along the lines of "I could have sworn I heard something outside" or "Maybe I missed something when I came through the music room", depending on the room the next clue is in. 

The story of the game is pretty good, but the ending was a little obtuse (though it does make sense). The dev has posted official explanations though if it interests you, so I highly recommend checking the discussion boards. I cant say much more about the story without ruining it, but it was certainly a shock and makes sense ultimately.

Another feature the game has that I loved, was that it "gauges" your fear/reactions. Running a lot, jerking your camera, etc, are all things that will increase the activity in the house. Youll get more sounds, more objects moving, more of the ghost appearing, all things to try and scare you even more. I loved it as it sort of forces you to control yourself to earn certain achievements. Get too scared though, and you run out of health,die, and have to reload that day.

As far as game bugs, I only found one where my character got locked in a room as part of a scene, but after the scene played out, the door never unlocked. Reloaded and it worked normally.

Speaking of reloading, the game doesnt have a save feature, but it does have a sort of checkpoint system. After everyday, the game saves before it starts the next day. The days arent super long (anywhere from 10-20 minutes long), so it shouldnt be a major issue. The longest day is probably the last, so be aware that the end day could take a good half hour and doesnt have a save.

Overall, I loved this game, and Im fairly shocked that it isnt rated much higher than it currently is. As far as indie horror (heck, even the high end horror games), this one is my new favorite. I loved the atmosphere, the random spooks, everything. The house was gorgeous, creepy, and fun to explore. Whoever made this absolutely nailed the old, haunted house vibe, and it was an absolute treat to finally find a game that lets us explore a haunted house without constant jumpscares around every turn, or chase scenes/things that physically kill you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159996075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4984, 'last_played': 1454738966}
review: Awesome concept for a game. Found especially the first 70% of the game really creepy. It has a slow buildup, but the scares are real and the ambiance really sets the tone for the game. The last 10 days leading up to the 'finale' of the game felt a bit too much like 'drawing the game out', 'repeating' alot of the same scares that went on earlier in the game. Once you've 'settled' into the setting of the game, it would've been nice to see something switch things up a bit, as to keep the game feel fresh before the final part of the game starts up. To summarize: If you like the buildup of a good horror vibe, and don't mind investigating an old mansion in the dark, unlocking new areas, and unraveling the mysteries that surrounds it, this is a must-buy. Sit down in the dark, and enjoy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983684753', 'num_games_owned': 2444, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1451016008}
review:
Pineview Drive is, simply put, tedium personified. This is one of the single most frustrating and boring "horror" games I've taken a crack at, and I've played a -lot- of horror games. Credit where credit is due: the mansion where most everything takes place is well-crafted and architecturally sound, actually feeling like a real-world building in size and layout. But beyond that, I can't say this game thrilled me at all.

The game parks you out in front of the titular Pineview Drive, or at least a mansion on said drive, without being entirely clear as to why you're there. You're informed, via a monologue by the main character, that no one's been able to stay there for 30 days straight. From there, you have a mind-numbing month of hunting for keys to look forward to, including the key to the front door itself. Were this not annoying enough, most of said keys aren't available to retrieve until various "spooky" events happen, forcing you to repeatedly comb the entire house, room by room, trying to trigger their spawns. Each day of the game (which is really a night, as your character didn't think to bring an alarm clock and wake up before the sun was about to set) ends when you've found enough keys to find a note bearing a sentence or two. These notes tell the story, what little there is, at a painfully slow pace.

To make things even more frustrating, the electricity gets blown out during a storm after so many nights, and rather than  call an electrician or check the fuses himself, your character seems content to suffer with a mediocre flashlight that drains batteries at an incredibly rapid pace and candles lit with whatever matches he can scrounge. This would be fine and dandy, if not appropriately spooky, if the battery supply at all kept up with how often you need to use the flashlight to find anything. Even with supply points spawning new batteries at random if you happen to run completely out, and the flashlight recharging slightly without fresh batteries to provide a few moments of faint light, you're stuck fumbling in the dark, waiting for doorknobs to highlight in the center of your vision so you can wiggle them to see if they're locked or check the contents of the rooms behind them for the umpteenth time. It wasn't long before I was wondering why you couldn't just pick up a candle, given several of them had handles on the candleholders, and you'd be better off spending matches relighting one than messing around with the flashlight.

I'm glad the scares are few and far between, as they give the legitimate ones a bit more impact; despite being jaded to most jump scares, there was at least one that kind of got me in Pineview Drive, though I can't remember which. However, the more randomized, mild scares that take small chips out of your "sanity" bar and can end your game if you take too long to progress, eventually get annoying since there are only two or three of them on rotation.

It's unlikely you'll have to worry too much about the aforementioned sanity bar until late in the game, when you've got that much more searching to do as you've unlocked most of the mansion, thus increasing your chances of getting spooked by something. There doesn't seem to be any way of restoring your sanity, either, save for regaining a portion once you finish a night and go to bed. This becomes a huge problem on the last day, which has a gauntlet of unavoidable scares that eventually leave you too depleted to actually finish the game. I made several attempts to clear the last area, and it seems utterly impossible.

The game tries to make things a bit easier on you by offering a hint if you've taken too long to find something, but most of these hints are too vague to be of any use, especially toward the end, and at least two or three triggered after I'd already found what they were hinting at and moved on. Long story short, Pineview Drive is a massive timesink that isn't particularly rewarding, and I suggest you pass on it for your patience's sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024275338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1452373950}

Ernsthaft. Spart euch das Geld und kauft euch lieber andere, bessere Spiele daf√ºr, EGAL ob es 95% Rabatt gebit oder so... NEIN!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980996509', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1511814012}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124968154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1451526783}
review:
10/10 would become a blind cave salamander again!!

Absolutely under no circumstances should you buy this game for the full asking price.  Actually, it may be best that you avoid it all together unless you like making yourself go blind while trying to see in perpetual darkness.  

How is this possible you ask?  I'll tell you.  Early on, the power goes out and stays out.  Good, considering that it was all but useless to begin with as the lights weren't very effective and would have to be turned back on constantly. Of course you still have matches, but seeing as how the candles are virtually as useless as the lights were for illuminating Pineview Drive's various rooms and hallways, that's a 'no go' too.  Wait, there's still the flashlight - thank god!  No, scratch that, it's just about the most useless thing you'll ever have the misfortune of using in any game as the batteries run out in like 30 seconds and the fractional amount you can still make use of makes a cave environment bright and sunny by comparison.

Then there's the 'key quest' the developers force you to go on each day; a day that begins 1 min. before nightfall, so you guessed it....time to go blind all over again, day-in, day-out. Also, there's the convoluted story which makes no sense and the lame jump scares which are only moderately creepy when they work right; otherwise, they're just annoying. About the only good thing going for this game is some decent sound effects/music and the achievements and trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973230221', 'num_games_owned': 14307, 'num_reviews': 849, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1451496400}
review:
So many rooms. Resident Evil 1 could learn from the size of this area. So the game is to find keys and then the door and then a further key or a letter that tell a little part of history what will awaits you. So you search and search at start you have little lights and you can burn candle and have flashlight but the lights will go after a few days and you need to find your way with the matches and batteries you have and find and need to care to not waste it, sure its not so dark that you dont see nothing but it will be hard and the areas get bigger and bigger and even places you know could spawn out of nothing the keys or other stuff. The flair is great and sound too. Its not easy to die till the end missions but to avoid some scares to get achievement are little challenges. I enjoy this game, even if some days are very short if you know where to search but damn if you search at end days whole house for 1 item and your items (batteries, matches) get used one by one and you need keep danger from all sides that is amazing. 

Really i like this game very much, but there are 2 dislikes 1 you cant make pictures with F12 and second you cant skip the long start (that is boring). Enjoy the scenes till the end and play 8 letters of Scarecrow (i doesnt do it but its a nice gimmick i think or watch the beautyful house (dont forget its an indie title) for every detail at SALES DAY after the game. One last thing, after all 1 room cant be open. Isnt it strange. WHAT IS IN IT? CAN IT BE OPEN? I give this title personaly 89 % so watch trailer and think about how much it is worth to you (5-10 so wait for 50-75% discount?!). Thank you for reading.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197997692528', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1451191888}
review: Well, I have made it to day 8 and I don't know if I am going to bother with day 9. Like the rest of the negative reviews state, you are basically just going through the house unlocking doors so you can find a key to unlock another door. No real rhyme or reason to it. In fact there were at least two times when the narrator had to say "Hey why don't you go check out this thing" so that I could find the next key, One of them I NEVER would have found because there was no real reason to go there. I am glad I got the key for this game so cheaply or I would be really upset. If you must try this game wait until it goes on sale for 90% off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998914313', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1449910067}
review:
I am trying so hard to like this game. I really am. It's so difficult to really like a game that has obvious repition. Just running around the mansion like a chicken with its head off, frustrated by so many locked doors, and just collecting keys. Lemme explain what its really like to play this game.

Day 1: Oooooh a Mansion...Ok collect this key...Open this door...find a note... Okay! Next day!

Day 2 and onward: Collect key, find a door among 30 doors that fit it, find another key in the room, find the door that fits it among the rest of the doors, find page... Next day. Wait for a hint cue where to trigger a jump scare so a key appears, find the door that fits it among more doors that are locked, find page, next day... Search every room you been in for jump scare trigger, collect the key that appears after, find the door that fits it among more f&@&#^ing doors, find another key, another door, get page, next day, random jump scare, get key, door, page, next day, jump scare, key, door, key, page, next day...

That's essentially the game. The game does get interesting. Lights get cut off. But there is no danger of running around in the dark without lighting candles or having your flashlight on. I am only on day 16 and its wearing me out with continous reptition and obvious triggers. Waiting for a hint from the protagonist so you know where the hell to go. Also you know where to go, because with all the running around you do, you'll know the huge mansion from front to back. Because you are checking every damn door to see if your key fits it.

The sound design is the highlight of the game. It has a very scary atmosphere. But with better execution this would be such a better game. Its demo that is free is so much better, even though all you do in the demo is walk, not make much noise, and hope the hands don't get you, and kill you... This game however is a painstaking effort of running around, collecting keys, opening doors, triggering jump scares to get another key, waiting for subtle hints from the protagonist, getting a page, and going to the next day.

Get this game only if that doesn't bother you what so ever. Other then that, I cannot recommend it. It starts to lose its charm only a few days in. Those who recommend the game sees the redeeming qualities and seem to tolerate the repitious nature of the game.

Added Note:

I've beaten the game. Story makes no sense really. Jump Scares kill you making the 30th day almost impossible to finish. But not impossible, I mean, I beat it.

Spoilers but Helpful Advice:

The clown pops in random rooms, reducing your health bar. As well as the scarecrow if you look at him while he is behind you, especially when your behind a window on the bottom floor. Also the girl when she pops up at random reduces your health bar, the cat reduces health, as well as the rats. Which are random in each room. So its unfair nonsense. First horror game I ever played where Jump Scares kill you... Really stupid mechanic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014039246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1623888058}
review:
Ein wahnsinnig gutes Horrorgame, super Scares ohne Ende mit vielen versteckten Kleinigkeiten und guter Story. Selbst beim Vierten durchspielen kriege ich es nicht hin, mich nicht bei bereits bekannten Scares f√ºrcherlich zu erschrecken. ^.^

Klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr alle Fans des gepflegten Atmosph√§renhorrors. Anmerkung: Hier gibt es keine Monster, keine blutigen Zombies und es l√§uft auch keiner dem Spieler mit der rasselnden Kettens√§ge hinterher. Meiner Meinung nach gibt es in diesem Spiel keinerlei physische Bedrohung, ist aber dennoch f√ºrchterlich gruselig und atmosph√§risch. 

Nachdem ich vom Horror-Aspekt des Spiels Outlast MEGA entt√§uscht wurde, ist Pineview Drive eindeutig mein Geheimtipp f√ºr den gepflegten atmosph√§rischen Horror. 

Last but not least m√∂chte ich den Entwickler pers√∂nlich und nat√ºrlich auch alle Beteilligten f√ºr ihre Meisterleistung loben und erwarte sehnlichst und mit voller Elan das n√§chste Horrorspiel aus dem Hause ViSGames :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1449342492}
review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Adventure Horror Spiel, ohne Abwechslung.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man Spielt einen Mann der vor 20 Jahren in seinem alten Haus seine Frau verloren hat.  Jetzt ist die erstmal die Hauptaufgabe eine Lichtquelle und Schl√ºssel zu suchen. Hat man die Streichh√∂lzer (um Kerzen anzuz√ºnden) und die Taschenlampe (und Batterien) gefunden sucht man die Schl√ºssel, die die verschlossenen T√ºren im Haus √∂ffnen. 

Der Mann steht immer kurz bevor es dunkel wird auf, sodass man gleich die Taschenlampe anmachen muss. Nun l√§uft man die ganze Zeit durch Haus und Probiert alle T√ºren aus die verschlossen sind bis man die richtige hat, dann wird man meistens mit einem neuen Schl√ºssel belohnt. Wenn mal kein Schl√ºssel da sein sollte kommt eine Grusel Einlage und man bekommt einen Schl√ºssel spendiert. Hat man alles Gesch√§ft wird erscheint eine Seite die einem zum n√§chsten Tag bringt. Sollte man aber mal nicht weiter wissen sagt der Mann dass einem schon wo man weiter kommt.

Die Perfekte Vorgehensweise um sich viel Lauferei und Batterien zu sparen ist:
1. Warten bis man gesagt bekommt wo man hingehen soll
2. Schl√ºssel finden
3. alle verschlossenen T√ºren testen
4. Schl√ºssel finden
5.  alle verschlossenen T√ºren testen
6. Schl√ºssel und Zettel f√ºr n√§chsten Tag finden

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grafik:

Die Grafik nicht gerade die beste f√ºr 2014 eher schlecht (HL¬≤ von 2006 sah besser aus)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Musik gibt es nicht wirklich, mehr Ger√§usche und kl√§nge zur Atmosph√§re.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die Steuerung Ok, trotzdem wirkt alles ziemlich tr√§ge und Schwerf√§llig an. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ Deutscher Untertitel
+ Deutsche Sprachausgabe
+ Gruselig
- immer das gleiche Schema 
- etwas unlogisch (warum steht man erst abends auf?)
- kein Always run

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Die Idee hinter dem Spiel ist ja garnichtmal so schlecht aber diese Einseitigkeit und st√§ndig widerholenden suchen nach den Schl√ºssel und testen der T√ºren nervt dann doch ganz sch√∂n. Ich hab gelesen das es 30 Tage geben soll und am 30igsten Tag muss man mal was anderes machen, ansonsten heisst es 29 Tage nur Schl√ºssel suchen und T√ºren testen. Am Anfang es Spiel wirkt es alles noch sehr unterhaltet aber wenn dann noch der Strom ausf√§llt ist wirklich der Ofen aus. Man rennt nur noch im Dunkeln rum, wenn man die Taschenlampe nicht anmacht. Wer also ein motivierendes Abenteuer erwartet ist hier falsch, etwas zum Grusel ist es zwar schon aber das macht den Rest nicht weg. F√ºr 19,99‚Ç¨ ist es sowieso viel zu teuer, da kann man sich wirklich was Besseres von kaufen.

Ich bin in circa 3,5h bis zu Tag 15 gekommen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 2/10
Grafik: 4/10
Musik: 8/10
Steuerung: 4/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003269050', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1552337230}
review:
Ich habe das Haupt-Spiel nun nach 30 Stunden hinter mir und bereue den Kauf im Halloween-Sale keineswegs. Das ist genau das was ich mir als Stift gew√ºnscht habe als ich Mitte der 90er Bilder von Games wie The 11th hour gesehen habe, was damals nat√ºrlich schlichtweg nicht m√∂glich war und zudem ein v√∂llig anderes Genre.

Dieses Spiel arbeitet nicht mit sinnlos gestreuten billigen scares, es arbeitet haupts√§chlich mit Atmosph√§re und Gewohnheit was bedeuten kann das man auch mal mehrere Minuten lang durch das Haus irrt, ohne "behelligt" zu werden, im Gegenteil man gew√∂hnt sich so an das Geb√§ude, das man irgendwann meint eine Manifestation erlebt zu haben ohne sich wirklich sicher zu sein. Ich hatte auf jeden Fall mehrere scary moments die ich aktuell noch nicht dem Spiel zuschreiben kann und genau so muss es sein. Ich finde das Spiel sehr gelungen. Die Licht und Schatten Effekte wirken √§u√üerst realistisch und setzen die Umgebung sehr gut in Szene. 

Abstriche macht das Spiel bei den t√§glichen Aufgabengestaltungen. Hier h√§tte man etwas mehr Interaktion und Abwechslung erwarten k√∂nnen. Gerade wenn nicht wirklich viel passiert kommt man sich wie ein Hund der einen Ball holen soll. Schl√ºssel suchen, √ºberall ausprobieren bis sich das passende Loch gefunden hat. Im zugeh√∂rigen Zimmer findet sich meist ein weiterer Schl√ºssel und das Spiel geht von neuem Los. Interessantere Aufgaben w√§ren hilfreich den Spieler mehr an das Game zu binden.
 
Dadurch kamen mir auch ein paar merkw√ºrdige Gedanken. Leidet die Spielfigur an Schlaflosigkeit oder ist er so Nachtaktiv das er immer die ganze Nacht auf den Beinen ist? W√§hrend man nach der Stelle sucht an der es weiter geht sch√ºttelt der Protagonist hin und wieder ein paar mehr oder weniger hilfreiche und manchmal hellseherische Hinweise aus dem √Ñrmel wie "Ich bin der Meinung in der K√ºche im zweiten Stock etwas gesehen zu haben". Dabei waren wir da noch gar nicht. Aber so bekommen wir wenigstens einen Hinweis wo es weiter geht. Die Kapazit√§t der Batterien unserer Taschenlampe ist weit unter Discounter-Niveau sodass ich mir angew√∂hnt habe diese nur bei √∂ffnen einer T√ºr oder bei Auftreten einer Manifestation anzuwenden. Man sollte sich die Orte an denen man eine Manifestation erlebt auch sehr genau ansehen, denn oft findet man dort die Schl√ºssel, welche man trotz der meist einfach gew√§hlten Ablageorte manchmal leicht √ºbersieht.

Ich gebe zu mich anfangs durch die Musikbr√ºcken und das hastige Atmen des Protagonisten h√§ufig im Kreis gedreht zu haben weil ich "Angst" hatte eine Manifestation zu verpassen. Das kommt aber √∂fter vor und ich bin der Meinung es soll gerade diese Art von Verfolgungswahn, Panik und Aufmerksamkeit erzeugen...bravo!  
Pl√∂tzlich verschwindende Gegenst√§nde welche man sich Sekunden vorher noch angesehen hat sowie (leider wenige) spontane bauliche Ver√§nderungen des Hauses sorgen auch f√ºr ein paar sch√∂ne Unbehaglichkeitsanf√§lle.

Das Unbehaglichkeits-Meter oder der Health-Bar sinkt ab und an ohne wirklich erkennbaren Grund. Ich hab es von vorne nach hinten durchgespielt ohne das diese einmal den Grund erreichte. Ich kann mir nicht genau Erkl√§ren wie diese  Anzeige funktioniert. Ich bin einfach meinen Weg gegangen und habe mir die Manifestationen immer sehr genau angesehen, war in einigen F√§llen sicher positiv.  

Leider gibt es keine direkte Controllerunterst√ºtzung aber halb so wild. Wenn man sich seinen Controller mit entsprechender Software auf Maus und Tastatur mountet spielt es sich wunderbar von der Couch. Ich rate allerdings davon ab die Shift Taste ebenfalls zu mounten. Meiner Meinung nach geht die Atmosph√§re durch zu schnelles Bewegen einfach verloren.  

Was ich mir noch nicht erkl√§ren kann sind lebendige Schatten die im Schein von Kerzen erscheinen. Sie haben menschliche Silhouetten und bewegen sich aber man sucht dessen Ursprung vergebens. Auf die Art wie sich diese Schatten bewegen habe ich auch nichts vergleichbares im Spiel gesehen...sehr mysteri√∂s...  

Kurz vor Ende des Spiels habe ich mich nochmal selbst gefragt was ich mir unter den freizuspielenden Modis wie zum Beispiel "Hausbegehung" vorstelle. Ich h√§tte mir eine Modi gew√ºnscht √§hnlich des Hauptspiels, jedoch das man mir ein paar Entscheidungen √ºberl√§sst. 
z.B... 
-Ist das Licht im Haus nutzbar?  
-Wie ergiebig sind die Discountbatterien?
-Wie h√§ufig ist mit einer Manifestation zu rechnen?
-auftretende optische Effekte?

Die verf√ºgbaren Modis werden mich nicht weiterhin an das Spiel ketten, was schade ist. Ich finde hier wurde Potential verschenkt. 

Zur Performance m√∂chte ich nur kurz sagen das ich absolut keine Probleme hatte. Ich habe das Game im Wohnzimmer auf meinem Beamer (720p) gezockt und hatte maxed out eigentlich st√§ndig 65-75FPS. Mir ist nicht ein Ruckler aufgefallen. Intel Core I7 3.5GHz, 16GB DDR3, ATI Radeon 7970 3G 
Aber was soll man hier gro√ü drauf eingehen, das erwarte ich von einem Game Mitte 2014 das mal ein Update erlebt hat.

Zusammenfassung:

Pros:
-√Ñu√üerst realistische und eindrucksvolle Beleuchtung
-sehr gelungene Atmosph√§re 
-Viele Unbehaglichkeitsmomente auch ohne billigen Nervenkitzel
-gro√ües Haus mit vielen zu entdeckenden Orten.
-gute Performance

Cons:
-Schl√ºssel, warum nur immer wieder Schl√ºssel?
-Keine Einstellungsm√∂glichkeiten zum Spielablauf
-Texturen k√∂nnten an manchen Stellen hochaufl√∂sender sein


Wer auf diese Atmosph√§re steht dem m√∂chte ich an der Stelle noch Layers of Fear ans Herz legen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043571157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1448193333}
review:
Good game, it has good atmosphere.I know that people complain on that you spend almost entire game searching for keys but i didn't mind it, if you are lost after some time game gives you a hint. I was really into story though game doesn't give you many answers leaving it up to the player, so if you like closure and definitive answer when it comes to the story you may not like it.

My complaints when it comes to this game are that it starts rather slow what can turn off some players early and is that game is too easy what after some time may affect "fear" factor of the game.

My final verdict is that i enjoyed this game, but sadly game isn't as good as it could be if some things were done better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970354057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1447370172}
review: This is basically Door Simulator 2015.  If 30 levels of endlessly opening the same doors in the dark, in order to be rewarded with a key (to open yet another door...) is your kind of thing, then snap this up.  Maybe pine-wood door would've been a better title. After trawling through what feels like 3 million doors, the ending makes no sense at all and the official explanation is even more nonsensical.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045114545', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1446897536}
review:
Un juego de miedo m√°s sutil de los que hay en el mercado actualmente. Me han gustado muchos elementos, y algunos detalles me gustaron por que asustan bastante. Pero no es un juego perfecto. Es demasiado largo, son 30 d√≠as de buscar llaves en una mansi√≥n, y cuando m√°s puertas abres m√°s puertas hay, al final pierdes bastante el sentido de la orientaci√≥n. Adem√°s, la casa est√° a oscuras el 95% del tiempo y las pilas de la linterna duran 2 minutos. Esto no ayuda a ver los gr√°ficos ni los sustos, algunos de ellos me los perd√≠ porque no ve√≠a un pijo.
Otra de las cosas malas es que el juego est√° hecho en Unity. Es un mal motor gr√°fico. Tuve que poner los gr√°ficos al m√≠nimo para poder jugar sin trompicones.
Y otra cosa es el final, que deja bastante que desear. Y tambi√©n los logros, la mitad son sobre no asustarse de alg√∫n evento, pero como no puedes controlar si te asustas o no, la obtenci√≥n de tales logros es aleatoria y no tiene ning√∫n m√©rito.
En resumen el juego es una buena experiencia, pero no perfecta. Este juego barato es muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088735835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1588545135}
review: Spine-chilling, great horror atmosphere with some really horrifying moments. I love it. Many of the points in the negative reviews  are also true though. Be aware that one must really play this game for the atmosphere most of all, as it has little more to offer. That, however, will not disappoint. You will be grabbing your mouse with tight muscles worried what would happen behind the next door. The sounds with which they made this happen are simply phenomenal - whoever was responsible for sound design has a great talent for keeping the player uneasy at all times. One of the best horror games I have played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979332326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1446563675}
review:
Keys, keys, keys.

There's a reason Resident Evil would make keys into shapes or animals or whatever - to give you an idea of what you got and where you could use it previously. Pineview Drive has terrible game pacing and design, so I'm getting keys and mashing E on doors hoping in vain it's the matching key.

review: spannend.. sehr viele schreckhafte momente.. vor allem wenn man es mitten in der nacht mit kopfh√∂rern spielt.. auf jedenfall ein sehr empfehlenswertes spiel f√ºr jeden horrorliebhaber.. sind zwar auch kleine mankos bei wie die ganzen entlichen r√§ume was verwirrend wird aber alles in allem sehr gut gelungen

author: {'steamid': '76561198028183257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1409413015}
review:
Man weis fast schon genau, wie jemand das Spiel angegangen ist, der es schlecht bewertet. Entweder ist es ein Schisser, der es am Tag gespielt hat, nicht alleine, keine Kopfh√∂rer auf und hat sich kein St√ºck darauf eingelassen, oder hat voller Vorurteile garnicht versucht, sich hinein zu versetzen - oder jene haben das Nachtlicht angelassen, wie das, f√ºr Kinder. Beides sind aber Zeichen f√ºr Angst. Wahre Kenner des subtilen Horros finden in dem Spiel ihren Spa√ü. Denn Pflicht ist, man muss es Nachts spielen - dazu nat√ºrlich alle Lichtquellen ausschalten, Kopfh√∂rer sollte man verwenden, sonst st√∂ren die Umgebungseinfl√ºsse. Am besten, man baut die Gruselstimmung vorher noch weiter auf. Und das wichtigste, man Muss sich darauf einlassen! Und sollte nicht den "coolen" Macker spielen.

So, wenn man das beachtet, dann kann man sich in das Game wagen. Nat√ºrlich geht es nicht sofort los, es baut sich eben langsam auf. Durchhetzen ist Dummheit, oder Angst. Was dem gleichkommt, als w√ºrde man ein Buch nur Halb lesen, weil man viele Seiten √ºberspringt. Man sollte sich zudem genau umschauen, √ºberwiegend nicht rennen. Und mit der Taschenlampe sparsam umgehen, wie auch mit den Streichh√∂lzern. Dann baut sich die Spannung, die Atmosph√§re langsam stetig auf. Nat√ºrlich ist der wahre Horror, Grusel nur da zu finden, wo man ihn pers√∂nlich selbst erlebt. Aber kaum ein Spiel schafft es, so zu gruseln. Aber halt auf einer subtilen Art und Weise.

Nicht so ein Schei√ü wie Doom, wo es viel mehr Action gibt, was mich Pers√∂nlich nicht gruselt, weil nur sehr wenig Spannung aufgebaut wird. Wo man also rumballert und mal hier mal da erschreckt wird. Gruselig ist auch nicht so ein Schei√ü wie Splatter. Splatter ist einfach sinnlose, dumme Gewaltdarstellung. Und hat nichts mit subtilen Horror zu tun. Subtiler Horror ist sowas wie die Geschichten von Lovecraft. Wer also auch mehr Wert auf den guten alten subtilen Horror, ala Lovecraft, steht. Der Wird mit diesem Game seinen Spa√ü haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109333284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1423803710}
review:
Slowly walking through a house.  Checking every room.  Looking for keys.  Waiting for something to happen.  So... boring... zzzzzzzzzzzz

*BOO!  Jump scare!*

B- wha?  I'm awake!  I'm awake.
Still walking.  Still checking.

*soundtrack goes ballistic*

What is it?  I don't see anything.
Whatever.  Still walking.  Still checking the rooms.

Up to night number nine, and now the power's gone out.

Yeah, fuck this.  It's bad enough looking around with the house lights, but now that I also have to think about conserving flashlight batteries, no.  I'm done.  Exit game.

If you like being bored and annoyed, [i]Pineview Drive[/i] has that in spades.  If you like feeling other emotions like, say, fear, definitely look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027608325', 'num_games_owned': 858, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1440530009}
review:
So hier jetzt auch mal meine Review zu dem Spiel: Pineview Drive.

Mir wurde das Spiel vor rund 6 Monaten von einem guten Freund empfohlen. Dieser hatte behauptet das 'Pineview Drive einen total kaputt machen w√ºrde weil es so scary ist'... Nunja, mein Interesse wurde dadurch geweckt, vor allem da ich f√ºr meinen Stream ein neues Horror-Projekt ben√∂tigt hatte.

Ich habe mir also die Demo runtergeladen und mir das Spiel 10 Minuten angeschaut... Eine super super gute und wirklich sehr atmosph√§rische Umgebung. Es ist nicht zu Hell / Dunkel, die Ger√§usche Kulisse ist sehr gelungen und der Grafik Stil passt absolut zum Genre und Spiel.

In diesen 10 Minuten wurde mir bereits bewusst das ich es unbedingt spielen m√∂chte. Ich kaufte mir das Spiel und los ging es.~

Das Gameplay:

Sehr simpel. √úberleben. Man l√§uft durch dieses mysteri√∂se Haus und sucht nach gewissen Gegenst√§nden / Schl√ºsseln um weiter zu kommen. Sollte man wirklich mal h√§ngen bleiben wird einem ein Tipp gegeben. Das ganze macht man dann 30 Tage lang.

Man muss immer bedenken: Das spiel ist ein Horror Spiel und somit nichts f√ºr schwache Nerven. Es existieren Jump Scares. Die Ger√§usche und Musik kulisse ist Perfekt. Man f√ºhlt sich dauerhaft verfolgt. Absolute Klasse.




Empfehle ich dieses Spiel? Ja. Definitv. Es lohnt sich, vor allem f√ºr diesen angenehmen Preis. Man hat ein nicht zu knappes Horror Spiel, welches einem garantiert G√§nsehaut geben wird.

Lasst euch selber √ºberraschen!
Euer IWannaBeTheMops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031374201', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1438565987}
review:
There are apparently 15 days (of hell) to go through.
The "scares" do not last.
You run around looking for keys that don't exist until you trigger a specific event.
There are no hints to these events until after 15minutes when the narrartor announces some sort of clue.
One of the big things I have an issue is how the keys to unlock the 75+ doors are not easily sightable.

I do not recommend this game, as you should be able to complete a game of this "type" in about 45- 60 minutes, however would take more closer to 3 hours while you wait for triggers or hints.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977919430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1439116205}
review:
The Game itself has some good ideas and the suspense is great for the first nights, But soon you realise that all you have to do is to find keys and open doors and find the next note.
You just have to manage your sanity until you do so. 

Great pontential but feels kind of unfinished due to the lacking of more than just keys and doors. If the devs had put in some riddles and some more story (like findig Books or dairies that are giving more insides about the story) it could have been a great jewel. 
But like this it just feels like half a game and half walking sim ...or better said:  escape the room game with nothing else to do than finding keys. 

Some jump scares and some wtf moments are in here too of course but thats all about this game. Do not get your hopes to high about this one.

Still i think its good enough for one playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561198007054218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1438630920}
review:
Ich verfasse jetzt mal eine erste Zwischenreview und werde mich dann nochmal abschlie√üend √§u√üern, wenn ich komplett durch bin. Im Moment befinde ich mich am 10. Tag und sagen wir mal so: T√ºr √∂ffnen, Schl√ºssel suchen, Treppen rauf, Treppen runter, raus in den Garten und wieder von vorne! Das klingt jetzt erstmal langweilig und eigentlich ist es das auch, w√§ren da nicht die Soundkulisse, die recht gut platzierten, zuf√§lligen Momente zum Erschrecken und die Tatsache, dass ich wissen, will, was eigentlich passiert ist. Diese Eigenschaften f√ºhren dazu, dass ich auch jetzt noch Lust habe, das Game weiter zu spielen. Die Idee, dass sich die Lebensenergie des Spielers verringert, wenn er sich erschrickt, ist zwar gut, aber nicht wirklich ausgereift. Im Prinzip wei√ü man ja nie, wann es zu so einem Moment kommt und daher kann man es auch nicht wirklich beeinflussen. Au√üerdem ist, zumindest bis jetzt (vielleicht √§ndert sich das noch im Verlauf), die Verringerung so gering, dass es √ºberhaupt keine Auswirkungen auf den Spielverlauf hat. Zumindest er√ºbrigt sich ziemlich schnell die Frage, warum man st√§ndig nach Batterien und Stgreichh√∂lzern suchen soll, wenn es doch √ºberall im Haus Lichtschalter und Lampen gibt... den Grund verrate ich hier allerdings nicht ;) - also, ich bin gespannt, ob ich die n√§chsten 20 Tage √ºberstehen werde! 

---> so, ich habe fertig! ;) mal davon abgesehen, dass ich tats√§chlich ein Game Over an Tag 27 hatte (einfach zu oft erschreckt), kann ich am Ende sagen, dass alleine Tag 30 (Finale) es wert ist, das Spiel bis zum Ende zu spielen! Mir hat's tats√§chlich sehr gut gefallen und auch wenn es zeitweise etwas eint√∂nig ist, kommt nicht wirklich Langeweile auf! Ich hab immer mal wieder in Reviews gelesen, dass die Schock-Effekte vorhersehbar w√§ren - das kann ich nicht best√§tigen. Obwohl ich fortan davon ausgegangen bin, dass ich mich wohl gleich wieder erschrecken werde, kamen die Effekte immer dann, wenn ich gar nicht damit gerechnet habe. Die Spielzeitangabe auf dem Cover ist mit ca. 8 Stunden angegeben - das haut auf jeden Fall hin! Eine Situation (die ich hier nat√ºrlich nicht definiere) hatte mich echt etwas verunsichert... ich denke, Ihr wisst, was ich meine, wenn Ihr Euch selber auf das Game einlasst... in diesem Sinne... viel Spa√ü in der Pineview Drive! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991921123', 'num_games_owned': 3825, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1477989620}
review: This game is not very well optimized, but I find the bit of story that is here rather intriguing.  The game itself is basically fetching key after key and trying to find the door that it unlocks to progress, which can ne tedious at times trying to remember what ones you've yet to open. The atmosphere is pretty good and the scares have been decent so far. I am currently at day 7 of 30 and plan to play through. Not worth $20 dollars, but if you can get it on a sale I'd say go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001597265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1436887565}
review:
You enter a mansion. You can't see ****. You look for keys to open doors to get access to other rooms to find keys to open doors. You find batteries. Your brilliant character won't pick them up cause you don't have a flashlight yet. You finally find flashlight to see something. Batteries die in less than a minute. You can't see ****. You go to where the batteries first were to pick them up cause you know, it's cool to not be blind like a bat looking for keys, but these batteries too, end in a minute. Sound effects abound to let me know something ominous happened but i can never know what cause i can't see ****. So there you are, can't see **** again and are still looking for clues. Then you find a note that ends day 1. 1/30th of the ways done. Day 2 begins. Finally a bit of light. OMG, nitghtime arrives at super speed, so, you can't see **** because the sun lasts just as long as the batteries... Now you have to revisit all rooms, to look for wich one something happened cause you need a key to open a new door that will allow you to find a key to open a new door where you won't be able to see ****. Some rooms have nice little details artistically. Only problem is... you can't see ****.

 All in all save money, just ask your wife or whatever to hide your car keys and close your eyes and look for them. Same thing, same fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153363947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1433333905}
review:
Das Spiel kann ich pers√∂nlich einfach nicht empfehlen. 
Ich habe es nicht zu Ende gespielt und habe es auch nicht vor, um das kurz festzuhalten. 

Denn Pineviewdrive spielt sich sehr schleppend. Lauf von A nach B zu C und wieder zu A. Warum ?
Schl√ºssel, denn darum dreht es sich im ganzen Spiel. Man braucht sie um T√ºren zu √∂ffnen und um den Tag (Level) beenden zu k√∂nnen. Dies ist aber leider so dr√∂ge und l√§stig sodass das Spiel einfach nicht in fahrt kommt. Und die Rumsucherei wird dabei von den Jumpscares immer mal wieder unterbrochen. Man erschreckt sich kurz und dann war's das schon wieder. Und da kommt das "Angst" System in's Spiel, welches den Klassischen Lebensbalken ersetzt. Dieser wird kleiner wenn man in einer Schrecksituation mit der Maus zuckt. Dies ist meiner Meinung nach aber absolut schlecht gemacht, denn nur weil ich mit der Maus schnell zur Seite ziehe, weil ich z.B. hinter mir etwas ge√∂rt habe, hei√üt es noch lange nicht das es eine Reaktion aus Angst war, als aus Reflex. Ich gebe zu das ich mich auch das ein oder andere mal erschrocken habe, aber das waren doch wirklich Einzelf√§lle. Pineview Drive ist eine Nette Idee aber es erzeugt einfach keine Angst, es ist eher der typische Mainstream Horror. Entweder ist es Splatter oder Jumpscares, das wird heutztage als Horror bezeichnet. Denn ein permanentes Gef√ºhl der Angst, bzw. Bedrohung ist nicht vorhanden. Deshalb kann ich das Spiel wirklich nur Leuten empfehlen die auf Sammeln und Jumpscares stehen. 

"Oh ich habe einen Schl√ºssel gefunden, jetzt darf ich wieder durch das Ganze Haus rennen um nach der passenden T√ºr zu suchen" 

"War ich hier nicht schoneinmal" 

"Wo ist dieser Schl√ºssel ?" 

"Schon wieder die Sc**** Batterien alle" 

Das sind die Dinge die euch im Spiel durch den Kopf gehen werden.

-> Spoiler Ahead <-

Man l√§uft durch einen dunklen Gang und h√∂rt ein leises "pshhht", da erschreckt man sich schon, es ist relativ simpel aber dennoch wirksam. An anderen Stellen ist es einfach nur...meh. Eine Vogelscheuchem an der man 100 Vorbeigerannt ist, bewegt sich. Huch wer h√§tte denn das erwartet ? Oder eine Skulptur die dich auf einmal anschaut, g√§hn. Eine Figur im Spiegel...wow.....Ein Poltern..bitte nicht...das ist so gruselig und √ºberhaupt nicht l√§cherlich, weil es das schon 100 mal in einem Spiel /Film gab. 

->Spoiler end<-

Ich hoffe ich konnte ein paar Leuten damit helfen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005069663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1432240729}
review:
‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ - "Dont touch it, its not worth your time" 

PROS:
- Really nice lighting and sound effects 

CONS:
- Keys, thats what they should rename this game. You find keys which aren't difficult to find at first and makes you believe your getting somewhere but there lies a fault. You have to try the key in every door to progress, thats it, that is all I endured in my time with the game.
- Backtracking, you will see the same corridors and rooms over and over again as you look for those damned keys.
- Dark, you cannot see a thing most of the time which is a shame because those lighting effects is the only good thing I can think of. It also makes no sense cause its forever daytime and theres no natural light whatsoever in the house.
- Spooky empty ghost house, yawn.
- Horror, its not scary whatsoever.

VERDICT?
 This game is awful, theres a serious lack of ideas and its not worth your time or money.

review:
Na moralzinha, que jogo sem no√ß√£o.







________________________________________________

author: {'steamid': '76561198004604990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1463064580}
review:
Ich fasse es mal kurz:

Die Atmosph√§re ist super! Kann dieses Spiel aber nur solchen Personen empfehlen, die auch auf Filme wie: Paranormal Activity abfahren. Warum? Es spielt sich so gut wie alles im Kopf ab, dieses Spiel ist nichts f√ºr Leute, die auf Splatter und Blut stehen. Es ist ein klassisches "Grusel-Ding" - die Betonung liegt auf Grusel - kein extremer Horror, teilweise sehr subtil, will es den Spieler m√ºrbe machen, was nicht immer gelingt. Wohl eher was f√ºr "Feingeister" und nicht f√ºr solche Spieler, die am liebsten jede T√ºr einlatschen und erstmal nen Headshot ansetzen. Es ist noch subtiler als Slenderman. Die Atmosph√§re hat was von diesen Geister-Dokus, die man im Abendprogramm ab 19 Uhr sehen kann, also sehr seicht mit Schreckmomenten, die sich aber auch in Grenzen halten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069941982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1524132149}
review:
It looks good. It has nice atmosphere. It has nice sounds. It's nice to try to figure out what's happened and what's happening.

...and then you realize it. You're just doing same thing over and over again. You wake up, open doors, walk through same rooms over and over again trying to find keys which are magically appearing somewhere in those rooms you have searched dozens times already in previous days. Occasionally you find new rooms which offer nothing new, really, only more rooms to research in following days.  In one of the rooms you (either new ones or old ones) you find next page of the story. When it will appear it ends the day. Sometimes you see something strange or hear something strange. That's all.

One day you just realize that you don't care that much about story that you bother to do that over and over again, walking from room to room, slowly, very slowly. There's not that much interest to find out how the story will end. Which is shame. Game could have been really good if there were genuine puzzles instead of walking around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960367763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1451218877}
review:
Unglaublich, dass man f√ºr dieses Spiel Geld verlangen darf. Ich muss einmal im Strafgesetzbuch nachschauen, ob ich dort irgendeinen Paragraphen finde......
Gottseidank habe ich dieses Spiel mit einem Bundle erhalten, denn gruselig hat es ja geklungen und ich wurde nicht entt√§uscht. Leider basiert der Grusel weniger auf dem Spiel oder die Spielidee, sondern auf der ewigen Suche nach Schl√ºsseln und das 10 000st millionste mal ein Zimmer auf zu suchen......
Gleich zu Beginn des Spieles wird Herzkranken und Schwangeren davon abgeraten das Spiel zu spielen und ich dachte "cool", das wird was werden. Tja, nun wei√ü ich warum: Man wird zum richtigen Psychopaten und Amokl√§ufer, wenn man zum zigten Male einen Raum aufsucht und nichts findet. W√§re ich dabei Schwanger gewesen (w√ºrde als Mann wahrscheinlich viel Geld damit verdienen, aber das ist eine andere Geschichte) dann h√§tte mein F√∂tus vor lauter Langeweile begonnen wie wild gegen meine Blase zu treten, so dass ich unentwegt auf das Klo h√§tte m√ºssen. Und DAS w√§re dann der blanke Horror gewesen, da ich mir vor jedem Betreten des Zimmers √ºberlegen h√§tte m√ºssen ob ich jetzt den Raum betrete oder doch lieber die T√ºre zur richtigen Toilette √∂ffne. In beiden F√§llen h√§tte ich sehr schnell sein m√ºssen....
Auch die Herzkranken h√§tten so ihre Probleme mit dem Spiel, den sie h√§tten sich unentwegt die Frage stellen m√ºssen: "Bleibt mein Herz heute oder erst an Tag 4 vor langeweile stehen???".
Achja und die Grafik und Spielsteuerung....naja beides mittelm√§√üg. Man kann es nicht schlechtreden, aber der Kn√ºller ist es auch nicht.
Fazit: Es mag ja Leute geben die dieses Spiel m√∂gen, aber ich glaube diese Personen sucht man im Promillebereich. Gibt ja auch Fu√üfetischisten und Briefmarkensammler......
Wer im Lotto gewonnen hat oder auf eine √ñlquelle gesto√üen ist, der kann es sich ja kaufen, aber ich denke das Geld bei einer Kiste Bier oder einem romantischen Abend mit seiner Frau/seinem Mann besser investiert.
